description: A retro-styled digital clock in the application Footer showing current time in 24-hour format (HH:MM:SS) with red digits on black background, updating every second. Clicking the clock opens NBA.com in a new tab.

userStories.title: Digital Clock in Footer
userStories.description: As a user, I want a retro-styled digital clock in the Footer so that I can check the current time at a glance and quickly access NBA.com.
acceptanceCriteria: A DigitalClock component is created and rendered inside the Footer, positioned after the 'Back to Top' button and before the decorative dots
The clock displays the current local time in 24-hour format as HH:MM:SS (e.g., '14:35:07'), zero-padded
The time updates every second using a client-side setInterval, with cleanup on unmount
The clock digits are red (#ff0000 or similar) on a solid black (#000000) background
The font is monospace (font-mono in Tailwind) to evoke a classic segmented display
The clock container has rounded corners, padding, and is horizontally centered in the footer
The styling is identical in light mode and dark mode (black background with red digits in both)
Clicking the clock opens https://www.nba.com in a new tab (target='_blank', rel='noopener noreferrer')
The clock has cursor-pointer and a visible hover state (e.g., subtle glow or brightness change)
The clock link has an aria-label describing the destination (e.g., 'Visit NBA.com')

userStories.title: Blinking Colons Like a Real 80s Clock
userStories.description: As a user, I want the colon separators in the clock to blink on and off every second so that the clock feels authentically retro like a real 1980s bedside alarm clock.
acceptanceCriteria: The two colon characters (:) between HH:MM and MM:SS toggle visibility every second (visible on even seconds, hidden on odd seconds)
When hidden, the colons are replaced with an equal-width blank space so the digits do not shift or jump
The blinking is driven by the same timer as the clock update, not a separate interval
A data-testid='clock-colon' attribute is on each colon span for testability
